newsitem.title: BERMUDA: ADT agrees to $86.1 mln settlement in suit.
newsitem.headline: ADT agrees to $86.1 mln settlement in suit.

text.p: ADT Ltd said Friday that Binder Hamlyn, the former auditor of Britannia Security Group Plc, has agreed to pay it $86.1 million to settle a lawsuit in connection with ADT's acquisition of Britannia in 1990.
ADT said it would be immediately paid $77.5 million and further payment of $8.6 million would be made on a deferred basis.
ADT obtained a judgment against Binder Hamlyn in December 1995 in the High Court of Justice in the United Kingdom.
Binder Hamlyn appealed and the case was due to be heard in later this year. As a result of the settlement, Binder Hamlyn has withdrawn the appeal, ADT said.
ADT, through its subsidiaries, is the largest provider of electronic security services in North America and the United Kingdom.
